Constructor Detail

MyAppListener

public MyAppListener(LocalDataAccess inputAccess,
                     int inputAppTimer)
The AppListener constructor initialise the action store location and the interval value. Calls the start() method on the thread which invokes the run() method of the thread.

Parameters:
inputAccess - log of actions
inputAppTimer - interval value
Method Detail

run

public void run()
The Application Listener class stores the application currently running on the device at specific intervals in the action log in the form of an action of type app.

The inherited run method is called when the constructor starts, the function obtains the id of the application running in the foreground on the device. It compares the id to the application heap. The application heap holds the application that have been running on the device stored on the devices memory This consists of the application id's with the corresponding name of the application. The application heap is searched using the foreground application id to find the name of the application. This is then stored to the action log as an action of type App.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread
